Title: The Ox-Bow Incident
Cast: Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Mary Beth Hughes, Anthony Quinn, William Eythe, Harry Morgan, Jane Darwell, Matt Briggs, Harry Davenport, Frank Conroy, Marc Lawrence, Paul Hurst, Victor Kilian, Chris-Pin Martin, Willard Robertson
Plot: When a posse catches up three men suspected of killing a local farmer, some of them become strongly divided on whether or not to lynch the men. Two drifters are passing through a Western town, when news comes in that a local farmer has been murdered and his cattle stolen. The townspeople, joined by the drifters, form a posse to catch the perpetrators. They find three men in possession of the cattle, and are determined to see justice done on the spot. Written by David Levene <D.S.Levene@durham.ac.uk>
Keywords: posse, justice, reading a letter, 19th century, horse riding
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 3 wins & 1 nomination.
Location: Alabama Hills, Lone Pine, California, USA
Actors: Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Mary Beth Hughes
Writer: Lamar Trotti (written for the screen by), Walter Van Tilburg Clark (from the novel by)
Description: Directed by William A. Wellman.  With Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Mary Beth Hughes, Anthony Quinn. When a posse catches up three men suspected of killing a local farmer, some of them become strongly divided on whether or not to lynch the men.
